epic: Digitize patient records and automate tracking.
user_story: As a Nurse, I want to access digitized patient assessments and care plans so that I can efficiently review patient information and update vitals.

acceptance_criteria.given: the Nurse is logged into the Clinician Portal
acceptance_criteria.then: the Nurse can view digitized assessments and care plans for that patient.

non_functional: The system must comply with HIPAA regulations.
The system must comply with FDA 21 CFR Part 11 regulations.

citations.snippet: The Trillium Health Day Health Manager is a system primarily used to assist Day Health staff in the tracking and care of patients in their Day Health program by multiple means.
An important assistive activity the system provides is to digitize what are currently physical artifacts such as patient assessments, care plans, and patient sign in/outs.
A clinician portal is required to present and organize the contents of the database.

epic: Replace Trillium's current system with a new system including database, clinician portal, and session application.
user_story: As a Doctor, I want to view patient data stored in the system so that I can effectively manage patient care.

acceptance_criteria.given: the Doctor is logged into the clinician portal
acceptance_criteria.then: the Doctor should be able to view all relevant patient data, including scanned documents and session information.

non_functional: The system must comply with HIPAA regulations.
The system must comply with FDA 21 CFR Part 11 regulations.

citations.snippet: The scope for this project includes everything Trillium needs to replace their current system with our system in addition to a couple of extra features.
The clinician portal is the primary user interface for our system.
The patients section will be where the user can add, modify, or check any patient data stored in the system.

user_story: As a Doctor, I want to access patient information through a web-based Clinician Portal, so that I can efficiently review patient data and modify information in the database.

acceptance_criteria.given: I am a Doctor logged into the Clinician Portal.
acceptance_criteria.when: I navigate to a patient's record.
acceptance_criteria.then: I can view and modify patient information in the database.

acceptance_criteria.given: I am a Doctor using the Clinician Portal.
acceptance_criteria.when: I access the application through a browser.
acceptance_criteria.then: The interface is easy to learn and navigate quickly.

non_functional: The Clinician Portal must comply with HIPAA regulations.
The Clinician Portal must comply with FDA 21 CFR Part 11 regulations.

citations.snippet: 4.1.1.Clinician Portal As a web­based application, will be the primary channel through which users access or modify any information in the database.
The interface must be easy to learn and navigate quickly.

user_story: As a Doctor, I want to view audit reports of patient data changes, so that I can ensure data integrity and compliance.

acceptance_criteria.given: I am logged in as a Doctor.
acceptance_criteria.when: I request an audit report for a specific patient.
acceptance_criteria.then: I should see a report showing the history of additions, changes, and deletions of documents and data, per user.

non_functional: Audit logs must be compliant with HIPAA and FDA 21 CFR Part 11.
Audit reports must be generated in a timely manner.

citations.snippet: 2.3.3.15.­ Reports which show auditing history, per user or per patient.

user_story: As a Day Health staff member, I want to digitize patient assessments and care plans, so that I can automate tracking of individuals through the program and improve the current physical workflow.

acceptance_criteria.given: I am a Day Health staff member using the Trillium Health Day Health Manager system.
acceptance_criteria.when: I access the system to manage patient information.
acceptance_criteria.then: I should be able to create and store digital versions of patient assessments and care plans.

acceptance_criteria.given: Digital patient assessments and care plans are stored in the system.
acceptance_criteria.when: A patient signs in or out of the Day Health program.
acceptance_criteria.then: The system should automatically track the individual's progress through the program.

citations.snippet: The Trillium Health Day Health Manager is a system primarily used to assist Day Health staff in the tracking and care of patients in their Day Health program by multiple means.
An important assistive activity the system provides is to digitize what are currently physical artifacts such as patient assessments, care plans, and patient sign in/outs.
As an improvement to the current physical workflow, the system will automate tracking of individuals through the program.

user_story: As a Day Health staff member, I want to digitize patient assessments, care plans, and sign in/outs so that I can automate tracking of individuals through the program and improve the current physical workflow.

acceptance_criteria.given: I am a Day Health staff member
acceptance_criteria.when: I access the Trillium Health Day Health Manager system
acceptance_criteria.then: I can digitize patient assessments, care plans, and patient sign in/outs.

acceptance_criteria.when: The system tracks individuals through the program

An important assistive activity the system provides is to digitize what are currently physical artifacts such as patient assessments, care plans, and patient sign in/outs.
As an improvement to the current physical workflow, the system will automate tracking of individuals through the program.

user_story: As a Doctor, I want to access patient data through the Clinician Portal so that I can review patient history and current status.

acceptance_criteria.given: I am a logged-in Doctor in the Clinician Portal.
acceptance_criteria.when: I search for and select a patient.
acceptance_criteria.then: I can view the patient's relevant data stored in the database.

non_functional: The system must comply with HIPAA regulations.

citations.snippet: database, the Clinician Portal, and the session application.
The scope primarily consists of three parts, the database, the clinician portal, and the session application.

user_story: As a Doctor, I want to add, modify, or check any patient data stored in the system, so that I can effectively manage patient information and provide appropriate care.

acceptance_criteria.given: I am logged in as a Doctor.
acceptance_criteria.when: I access the patient data management section.
acceptance_criteria.then: I should be able to add new patient records, modify existing patient information, and view patient details.

non_functional: The system must comply with HIPAA regulations.
The system must comply with FDA 21 CFR Part 11.

citations.snippet: user can add, modify, or check any patient data stored in the system. This includes basic functionality such as adding a new patient, adding a new scanned document to a patient, or checking on a patient’s basic info.

user_story: As a Doctor, I want to view patient data in the clinician portal so that I can effectively manage patient care.

acceptance_criteria.given: I am a logged-in Doctor in the clinician portal.
acceptance_criteria.then: I should see the patient's relevant clinical information and documents organized in a meaningful way.

non_functional: The system must comply with HIPAA regulations.
The system must comply with FDA 21 CFR Part 11 regulations.

user_story: As a Doctor, I want to access patient data through the clinician portal so that I can efficiently review patient information and provide better care.

acceptance_criteria.given: I am logged into the clinician portal as a Doctor.
acceptance_criteria.when: I search for and select a patient.
acceptance_criteria.then: I can view the patient's relevant clinical information and documents stored in the database.
